newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares edge up at noon in narrow trade.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares edge up at noon in narrow trade.

text.p: Shanghai's foreign currency B shares edged higher on Thursday morning but trading was confined to a narrow range as investors awaited fresh news, brokers said.
Signs are emerging that sentiment is on improving, helped by talk that recent market falls were too sharp given Beijing's aim to promote stability of share prices, they said.
The B index rose 0.648 points or 0.88 percent to 74.374 points on volume of 5.899 million shares worth $3.040 million.
"Domestic retail investors are still the main buyers in the market," said a local broker.
"After yesterday's solid gains and today's rise, there are hopes of a recovery in market sentiment," he said.
"But the market is still likely to experience short term fluctuations because of uncertainty about direction," he added.

The Shanghai B index rebounded 3.4 percent on Wednesday on bargain hunting after a series of falls since the July 1 return of Hong Kong from British to Chinese rule, which had been a major positive factor for the market, brokers said.
But many investors were still hesitant to return to the market as they awaited fresh news, brokers said.
"In the short term, there is no clear trend so people are just waiting for news," said an analyst at an Asian securities firm in Shanghai.
"Overall sentiment is not that good, but people expect interim results to be better this year," he said.
Companies would report results for the first half of 1997 later this month and in August, and strong performances by individual companies were expected to attract selective buying, brokers said.
Of 45 B shares, 35 traded in the morning session, with 21 up, 10 down and four flat.
Domestic currency A shares also inched higher, helped by talk that the government would slow the pace of new share listings and issues, brokers said.
The A index gained 3.210 points or 0.27 percent to 1,174.411 on volume of 120.438 million shares worth 1.408 billion yuan.
The SSE30 blue chip index gained 16.319 points or 0.44 percent to 3,730.341 points.
Brokers said the A and B share markets were likely to continue to move around current levels in afternoon trading on Thursday.
